column5: As the days go by the Reports get closer to the end, May 4th the Salmon continue on their voyage to grow up on one of the Saugeen's Tributaries & hopefully be caught by one of us or someone who appreciates the time & effort the local clubs put into making our days on the water a success, it sounds like the teacher is interested in doing this next year so we can continue teaching some kids it can be fun to put back into our Natural Resources, Tight Lines & Have a Great Opener SBK Click the picture for Video
Wow ...salmon and chicken ...ive got fish crisp and shake and bake ....willing to travel if i dont have to do dishes...lol..
What about the guinea pigs LOL what too small to roast SBK

That's awesome We did the classroom hatchery in Stevensville for the last two years but they died both times. The kids were upset but gained an even greater respect for the environment. They're more determined than ever to keep our streams clean. This year the school is trying a third time but have the tank in the hall instead of the class. This way the whole school gets to watch.

im going to guess that guinea pigs would taste like muskrat...i tried it once at a EVERYTHING Wild pot luck many years ago at our gun club....  never again ....besides do they make a guinea coating???lol...  Nice job on the hatchery Richard  ...hows the mortality from this batch?

We lost about 25% they looked like they starved to death, all head & no body, one of the guys said it could be a vitamin difficency & they won't eat, we are changing 5 to 10 gallons of water every day & checking the ammonia levels & adding 10mil of chemical every day, the class is on hourly feedings from 7:30 to 4pm, the kids love it, we lost 6 last Monday & 1 Wednesday, I'm on feeding detail Friday & Sunday & the Teacher is coming over Saturday & Monday, under 2 weeks now SBK
